stepTitle: Calculate the standard enthalpy change ΔH° at 25°C for the following reaction:\n\nN₂H₄(l) + $$3$$ O₂(g) → $$2$$ NO₂(g) + $$2$$ H₂O(l)
stepBody:
Consider:
ΔH_f° $$NO_2$$ $$=$$ $$33.18$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° $$H_2 O$$ $$=$$ $$-285.83$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° $$N_2 H_4=$$ $$50.63$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° $$O_2$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$

Compute your answer in kJ to two decimal places.
